item.title: seL4 Microkernel: Architecture
item.description: The balance between safety and security versus high-performance and high-throughput has always been a challenge in OS design. Although not mutually exclusive, making something safer usually lowers performance, which could be due to software design or hardware limitations. To combat this, modern hardware features things like MMUs, privilege levels and virtualization. But they alone are not enough. The software should also be designed and implemented smartly to make use of the hardware the right way.

item.title: What are CPU Architectures & ISAs? ELI5
item.description: We all probably have heard them: ARM, RISC-V, CISC, x86, x64, AARCH64, AMD64â€¦ Why are there so many of them? Why do they sound so mathematical and scientific?
